==Latin==

===Etymology===
From {{inh|la|itc-pro|*wōs}}, from the oblique case forms of {{der|la|ine-pro|*yū́}}.

===Pronunciation===
* {{la-IPA|vōs|eccl=yes}}

===Pronoun===
{{head|la|pronoun|head=vōs}}

# [[you]], [[ye]], you all; nominative plural of [[tu|tū]]
# [[you]], [[ye]], you all; accusative plural of [[tu|tū]]

====Usage notes====
When used in the plural genitive, {{m|la|vestrī}} is used when it is the object of an action, especially when used with a gerund or gerundive. When used in such a construction, the gerund or gerundive takes on the [[masculine]] [[genitive]] [[singular]]. {{m|la|vestrum|Vestrum}} is used as a partitive genitive, used in constructions such as ''(one '''of you''')''.

====Declension====
{{la-decl-ppron}}

====Derived terms====
* {{l|la|vobiscum}}
